journals.notes:
Stable package in AUR has been updated for 2.71rc2, with the tagged source tarball being now directly downloaded from GH. Note that the package is *not* splitted (etlegacy and etlegacy-mod), since this doesn't make sense with package that have to be compiled anyway.

For the next 'stable' releases, the PKGBUILD compilation option will need to be adjusted (some renaming on the way in CMakeList.txt, maybe some additional options) but then a simple change of the version string will be enough to provide ET:L to Arch users.

This is now fully done, the package requiring only the version bump on new release.
The stable version now includes precompiled mod binaries from the official package, as stated in the wiki.
Spyhawk, you did that for rc3 - and not for 2.71 stable ;)

Doesn't matter, the "hard" work of writing a correct PKGBUILD is now fully done. Only the version variable needs to be changed at every release, and this can be simply done by the Arch users themselves if I'm not fast enough :)

details.name: description
details.old_value:
etlegacy is provided in the AUR.
- etlegacy provides the last stable version
- etlegacy-git provides the last development version

Although the etlegacy-git PKGBUILD is up-to-date, the etlegacy PKGBUILD simply provides the binary version available in the "general Linux" tar.gz archive.

The stable version PKGBUILD should provide a compiled version (once the version is correctly tagged).
Note that split packages aren't officially supported in the AUR currently, but this is coming soon (see #FS15043, FS#16394).
details.new_value:
etlegacy is provided in the AUR.
- etlegacy provides the last stable version
- etlegacy-git provides the last development version

Although the etlegacy-git PKGBUILD is up-to-date, the etlegacy PKGBUILD simply provides the binary version available in the "general Linux" tar.gz archive.

The stable version PKGBUILD should provide a compiled version (once the version is correctly tagged).
-Note that split packages aren't officially supported in the AUR currently, but this is coming soon (see #FS15043, FS#16394).- Split package support has been added to the AUR as of 27.05.14.

journals.notes:
TODO:
* create a separate PKGBUILD for the 64bit version. (\)
* update all PKGBUILDs to make use of the carch specific fields (from pacman 4.2, released this week end). (\)
* Update both the stable (\) and git version (\).
* create a 64bit omni-bot PKGBUILD if possible (+ svn version?). (!)

Stable Arch PKGBUILDs are almost ready. I'm missing the official .pk3 on the etlegacy mirror (official static packages, or "etlegacy-common-2.71a" pack ) so the .pk3 can be fetched.

The new pacman 4.2 syntax has been added, but commented out for now. Waiting for pacman 4.2 to reach [core].

subject: Create 2.71 distribution packages for Arch
description:
etlegacy is provided in the AUR.
- etlegacy provides the last stable version
- etlegacy-git provides the last development version

Although the etlegacy-git PKGBUILD is up-to-date, the etlegacy PKGBUILD simply provides the binary version available in the "general Linux" tar.gz archive.

The stable version PKGBUILD should provide a compiled version (once the version is correctly tagged).
-Note that split packages aren't officially supported in the AUR currently, but this is coming soon (see #FS15043, FS#16394).- Split package support has been added to the AUR as of 27.05.14.
